diagnosis.final_diagnosis: high-grade osteoblastic osteosarcoma arising in a background of long-standing fibrous dysplasia
diagnosis.diagnostic_reasoning: The final diagnosis was based on histologic analysis of the resected specimen, which confirmed high-grade osteosarcoma in a patient with Mazabraud syndrome and a prior diagnosis of fibrous dysplasia. Initial imaging indicated fibrous dysplasia, but biopsy results showed poorly differentiated malignant cells, leading to further analysis that identified the osteosarcoma.
